content: This is a terrible option for divorced parents. The process creates a "parent wallet" that monies are transferred into from your linked bank account. The problem is that once you link you account your ex now has access to your account and can move monies from your account without your approval. Once the monies are in the "parent wallet" they can be dispersed either to the child's wallet, or back to any linked account, like your ex's. Shady to say the least, and poorly thought out.

content: I do not recommend this service, as you can not cancel online (though they are more than happy to sign you up online). They will also take the monthly fee from your bank account via ACH, so if your balance is low, you will overdraft, even if you have your debit card locked (that wouldn't normally be a concern but a lot of people aren't carrying large, stable bank balances during this pandemic). Last but not least, when attempting to reset my password, the recovery email never arrived (yes, I checked my spam folder, and tried more than once). I will now be going to my bank to have them block any further payments to this company and their non-existent online customer service. It's a great idea, but service is severely lacking - especially considering you have to pay to use it. You are FAR better off just opening a regular account through your existing bank for your child, and transfering funds to it through the banking app you already use, or just get them a reloadable Visa gift card.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear about this experience, Joe. Please contact us at support@greenlightcard.com or 888-483-2645 so we can assist you with your account and answer any questions you may have.
